author: National Bureau
text:
The Central Board of Direct Taxes on Thursday clarified the rules regarding the quoting of PAN for certain transactions which will come into effect from January 1, 2016. “It has been decided that quoting of PAN will be required for transactions of an amount exceeding Rs. 2 lakh regardless of the mode of payment,” the CBDT said in a release, adding that the previous limit was Rs. 1 lakh as announced by Finance Minister Arun Jaitley in his Budget speech.

The CBDT also said that in an effort to balance the burden of compliance on legitimate transactions and the need to capture information regarding high-value transactions, the government has increased the monetary limits for many transactions requiring the quoting of PAN.
title: CBDT clarifies rules regarding quoting of PAN
